DOC.brief_summary: To study ownership and use of cell phones in low-income smokers. This may help us better understand the impact of cell phone ownership plans on low income smokers' access to quitlines. Use of quitlines may be impeded by limited access to landline phones and limited airtime minutes on cell phones.
DOC.brief_title: Survey of Smokers Treated in the Emergency Department (ED) on Ownership and Usage of Cell Phones
DOC.criteria: Age 18 or over speak and understand English willing and able to give informed consent have smoked more than 100 cigarettes lifetime are currently a daily or some day smoker too ill or unable to consent not interested in participation actively psychotic or mentally ill and unable to give consent in police custody resides in an extended care facility.
